name: Hilton Waikiki Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights with wife. Upgraded to ocean-view room (Diamond member). We usually stay at the Marriott Beach Resort one block over, so I'm comparing the two head to head on many areas. Hilton wins based on the following:
reviews.title: This Hilton beats neighboring Marriott

reviews.text: -smaller room but "cozier feel"
reviews.title: Great stay! Friendly staff and Fantastic location!

reviews.text: -super-quiet, efficient AC that doesn't cycle on/off every few minutes
reviews.title: Visited a 2nd Time, Very Different Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -peace and quiet at night. The Marriott suffers from neighboring Aston and its own nightly outdoor entertaiment
reviews.title: Great hotel as you would expect from Hitlon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -internet access--complimentary for Diamond and Gold members. Wired only in-room (preferred for security) and was quite fast. Easy one-touch sign on and never even billed to room (to be removed later like some other places)
reviews.title: Very attentive to guests needs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was nice to stay in, the shower made the floor a little wet and the lighting could have been better, but the beds were comfortable. The staff was a little... persistant... like if the door was locked and no one answered they come back and knock every 5 minutes which can be annoying when you're trying to sleep (obviosuly if the latch is locked, it must have been done from the inside, so its very possible there are people in there who just don't want thier room cleaned right now!).
reviews.title: Good but bad calls later!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest problem for me came a month or two after my stay. I get spam phone calls asking if I want deals on hotels in Orlando or Vegas and when I ask them to take me off the calling list they give me an attitude about how it's fine and I can "have a good time paying full price when I travel".
reviews.title: Nice room - great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My recommendation is that if you stay at a Hilton hotel, make sure you don't give them your real phone number!
reviews.title: Disapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked this hotel . The room and bath were modern and a nice size. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Ali at the reception area. We ate at the restaurant and found the food to be good and reasonably priced for Waikiki. The room was clean and comfortable. We thought the rate of $167 a night was a very good value.
reviews.title: Don't hesitate - the hotel is FANTASTIC !

reviews.text: The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the beach.
reviews.title: Crisp, clean, cool, and calming in a crazy busy world...

reviews.text: We spent a weekend at the Hilton Waikiki Beach. The hotel is about one block from the beach which is a short five minute walk. We booked an ocean view room and asked for a room as high as possible, so we ended up on the 30th floor. It was stunning and my husband and I spent many hours sitting on the Lanai enjoying the view and the view just watching the hustle and bustle of Honolulu, the surfers, the planes....we loved it! We ordered room service twice (breakfast on the lanai was just PERFECT!) from MAC 24/7. The Mac and Cheese is very yummy! On the downside, the hotel pool is tiny and very windy (10th floor)But let's be honest, why waste your time at the pool when you have a pristine beach right in front of you? Yes, you will hear city noises (doh you ARE in a major city!!!) It's not a remote beach in the middle of nowhere, so if you don't want to hear city noises book a hotel outside of Honolulu!! Splurge on the ocean view, get a room as high up as you can and enjoy the ocean breeze!
reviews.title: Great hotel, very clean and beautifully renovated.

reviews.text: Our check in with Chad at the front desk was more than I could expect after dealing with horrible airline issues.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hilton Honors location.....Great executive lounge

reviews.text: We were immediately identified as Gold members and given all the upgrades that come with the program. The executive lounge included full breakfast and two hours of evening hot pupus.
reviews.title: Bring money, it sure is nice.

reviews.text: Rooms are clean and the view from the 28th floor was great.
reviews.title: Mac 24-7 great. Hotel nice. Concierge meh. Lobby soundtrack horrible.

reviews.text: Staff was top notch especially Chad who remembered names in our party and gave out handy tips during our week long stay.
reviews.title: Comfortable
Love this place when in Honolulu on business
reviews.text: We love staying here. Best part of the stays are Myles & Britney at the pool bar. Excellent service and fun to visit with. Hotel staff is always very professional accommodating. For diamond and gold members the breakfast is awesome. Hot food and lots of choices.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: This Hilton is in a great location, but there was a lot of noise from the street and our neighbors. We were on the 6th floor and requested to be moved to a higher floor, but they were unable to accomodate our request. We didn't have a clear view of the beach because other Hotels blocked our view. The valet parking attendants could be more helpful. They watched us load our luggage and never offered to help :o( You are required to Valet Park, and they charge $25 a day. They should be more helpful. We were rarely at the Hotel and it was a great place to crash! The only other negative is that there are two windows in the bathroom that face the hotel room, so if you turn the lights on in the bathroom it lights up the whole room. They have mini blinds in the windows (it was very ODD) but the blinds didn't block out the light. The hotel was very clean and most of the staff very helpful and friendly.

reviews.title: Best service ever
reviews.text: The girl at the desk "celeena" was an angel, she helped us with everything with a big smile! You should have her to help you! She will do everything in her power to help you as good as possible, she made our stay a lot more pleasant. Thanks celeena!

reviews.title: Actually not as good as I expected
reviews.text: I can't complain about the decor, cleanliness or service as all were exemplary. However I have a few issues

reviews.title: Nothing to offer
reviews.text: 1. There is no free basic wifi in rooms. I have come to expect that and it was annoying to have to go down to the lobby to check my emails.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been to Waikiki one time before, staying at the nearby Marriott, and this hotel was always one we were considering...so the second time around we chose the prince kuhio. The reviews on tripadvisor helped a lot in making our decision, and the fact that the general manager took the time to read and reply to all of the reviews was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: When we arrived the staff at the front desk were very good, very pleasant and welcoming (very nice, after a long flight!). Our room was on the 17th floor, and we were hoping for something higher but nothing was available. But the staff put us on a waitlist and after 2 days we were given a phone call asking if we wanted to move to the 27th floor. We decided to stay where we were because we were already settled in and the view was still very nice, but appreciated the gesture still.
reviews.title: Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else in Waikiki

reviews.text: As for the room itself, it is very nice, spacious enough and up to date. The bathrooms are gorgeous for a hotel, and yes there are two glass windows in the wall that separates the bathroom from the rest of the room, but shades can be pulled down for privacy. The closet is in the bathroom, which didn't bother us but we could see how it could be a bit of an inconvenience. A tall building a few blocks up puts a big wall in the middle of the ocean view, and we were wondering if our view from the 17th floor would be good enough because there are a few buildings in front of the hotel. But we were pleasantly surprised, from the 17th floor it was still pretty good. There are nice windows by the elevators on every floor so you can enjoy the view for a few seconds before you get into them.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was readily available for any questions we had, and gave us a room to use for an hour to change and shower when it was time for us to leave. Check our was in the morning and our flight was not until 6pm, so it was very comforting to know that we could still spend our last day at the beach!
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!

reviews.text: We visited the MAC 24-7 a few times, having breakfast there one day and a quick bite to eat before we went out another night. The food portions were good, and prices are what is to be expected in a hotel. The menu has a variety of different meals, and of course those huge pancakes that everyone has been talking about. We saw a few being served during our breakfast, and people would literally stop eating and stare (us included). We saw a party of four leave the table with half of the dish still on the table!
reviews.title: Best hotel we have ever stayed!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for seven nights this month. Check in was quick -- everything about the reservation was accurate. Reception and housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. Was upgraded from a city-view room to an ocean view room because of my "gold" card. The room was very comfortable. The outdoor pool and hot tub on the 10th floor are wonderful -- great way to relax after a long day! The food in the bar and the restaurant are only so-so (tried each once), but the location is convenient to a good number of nearby choices. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great room, great location, friendly staff!
FIVE STAR ALL THE WAY!!!
reviews.text: We just returned from Hawaii and stayed at the Radisson for six nights. The staff went so far above and beyond for my fiance and family staying at this hotel. To HOWARD the conceirge who was SUCH a total joy and pleasure to deal with. To KATHY who was the sales manager who on a moments notice arranged for us to hold our wedding ceremony in their Gazebo/Garden area because of weather. The Radisoon Accomodated every request no matter how small. Our room was on the 18th floor and had excellent ocean view.

reviews.title: Radisson just adequate
reviews.text: Being a bit of a germ a phobe I found the room and hotel very clean. I know they are under construction and remodling and my new Husband and I can not wait to come back next year to celebrate.

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: I would reccomend getting the breakfast buffet with your package all of our friends and family that stayed at this hotel regretted not having it included as they ended up having breakfast there almost every morning anyway. THANK YOU TO ALL THE STAFF.

We stayed at the Radisson Prince Kuhio Hotel in Honolulu and do not plan to ever stay there again. Our reservations were made in May of 2005 for our vacation in March of 2006, on the Kuhio Club floor. We were under the impression these rooms cost more, therefore you get nicer rooms, etc. We were totally wrong. When we arrived one of our rooms was not on the Prince Kuhio floor. We had to ask for robes (which we were told were furnished with the room). The evening hors de ouvres were okay, but nothing like the J. W. Marriott (where we have stayed before).
reviews.title: Great location,friendly staff.

reviews.text: For the price, this was one of the most convenient hotels to stay in. It is on Kuhio, 1 block back from the beach and walking distance to just about everything you would want from Waikiki beach. There are plenty of beaches to choose from to lounge on. Pleanty of eateries, shops, department/apparel/designer stores. However, you will be on the very end of the "wakiki strip" near Kapiolani park. I found that I did not need anything from the other end, which is close to the convention center, so this was not a problem for me. If anything, I found it a great opportunity to take a nice stroll along the beaches or Ala Wai Blvd (which is where most of the shops are).
reviews.title: Location as Convenient as Expected
Oahu, not as advertised !!!!
reviews.text: As for the hotel in detail:

1 - the cleanliness was average to below average. I would say 3 star is accurate. Everything that could be taken care of on a daily basis was done very well: clean sheets, clean towels, good overall room cleaning. But the carpet in general is very old.
reviews.title: Good for what we needed
Radisson ok, probably better after renovations are compelete
reviews.text: 2 - the elevators were super slow. At first I didn't notice a thing until the weekend came and then I noticed the inconvenience of the 2 elevators being repaired. However, they inform guests on signs that they should use the service elevators so in the end, we weren't inconvenienced too much over the course of our 5 nights.

reviews.title: Loved Waikiki
reviews.text: 3 - the room that we were in on I believe the 7th floor was SUPER windy. It was impossible for me to sit out on the balcony. We still left the door open for fresh beach air, but it did get pretty noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the Hilton Prince Kuhio and booking directly with Hilton with an advance purchase really saved us some money.
reviews.title: Great value and excellent refurb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here twice, three nights each (with Kauai in between). First time we were upgraded to an oceanview, not as lucky the second time.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great refurbishment; the bathroom is excellent and stocked well, and the new flat screen TV and decor really great. The front desk also very helpful, and the free internet in the lobby helped.
reviews.title: Not friendly to travel agents

likes.disliked: — No interest in accommodating us when the power outage lasted over 12 hours.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Waikiki is small, so the location we liked. We didn't like the restaurant downstairs, however. The breakfast was quite so-so; we had breakfast and all meals elsewhere.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for Singles

likes.liked: — The cleanliness of the room, free Internet on the Executive Level, good staff

reviews.text: The pool is nice but old fashioned, but I liked it.
reviews.title: A Fine Hotel, But Some Ups and Downs.

likes.disliked: — How CHEAP they go for the 'Executive Lounge'...PITIFUL AND TACKY!

reviews.title: Loved the Prince Kuhio Radisson Horel
reviews.text: Our travel agent suggested this hotel and apologized for it being only 3 stars. Needless to say, we had low expectations especially after we read other Travel Advisor reports about the hotel, but what the heck - we were going to be on the beach everyday!

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Boy, were we in for a treat. The hotel was lovely, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the food was terrific. Breakfast buffet was a part of our package, much to our surprise and delight, and the food was well prepared and plentiful and catered to a variety of cultures. Rice, both white and fried; potato pancakes; bagels; lots of fresh fruit and 5-6 melon choices; egg choice was changed daily from basic scrambled to Eggs Benedict to Eggs Florentine. Bacon, Sausage and ham were often the meat choices. At least 4 juice choices as well as teas, coffee and milk for beverages. Bread for toast, croissants, danish pastry etc and the list goes on.

reviews.title: Great Place!
reviews.text: Our reservation was for an ocean view room with a king bed and when we checked in we had an ocean view room with 2 queens. When I brought this to the clerk's attention she promptly switched us to what we wanted - no if's, and's or but's about it and it was 1 o'clock in the morning!
This hotel is about 2 blocks from the beach and on a main bus route so getting around town was pretty easy.
reviews.title: Convenient yet quiet location
Convient location/Mildew in the walls (includes Oahu tips)
reviews.text: The room was very comfortably and clean. The linae was tiny but did accommodate 2 chairs and a small table and since we "don't do heights" and were on the 33rd floor, it was fine with us. TV with cable and pay-per-view stations, nice dresser and 2 night stands with deep drawers. Coffee pot and complimentary Kona Coffee-both regular and decaf. More than 1 packet of each would have been nice but not a big deal and hardly worth mentioning. Plenty of towels in the bathroom. Internet is available in the room for about $10 per day plus tax, but is complimentary in the Business Center in the lobby.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here from June 15-June 18. We were on the 27th floor, ocean view. Balconies were open, all new appointments. Very comfortable beds, nice bathroom, enough space for 4. Breakfast was included-- continental included pineapple, croissants, cinnamon buns, or blueberry scones, coffee, tea. The American breakfast was eggs, fried potatoes, bacon, sausage, or ham, toast or rolls, very satisfactory. We loved the fresh pineapple every morning. Elevators were very fast, never had to wait. Had the snacks and drinks in the lobby in the evening. The parking attendants were very helpful. We were a block from the beach right by the pavilion and ABC stores on about every corner. Very convenient and all in all, a great stay. We'd stay again.
I can't express how much I loved this hotel, and how comfortable I was there. I booked a room thru the hotel's site directly - went with
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.disliked: — Water pressure in shower, expensive parking.

reviews.text: room designated at check-in, which was the lowest rate by the way. When I got there, I had 30th floor, Ocean View, and I could use the balcony, too. Low key hotel, off the strip with a gorgeous view, and very well appointed rooms. Not fancy, but very comfortable and mod. Bathroom was great, although water pressure could have been better (but it was the 30th floor!). Very comfortable beds with nice linens,
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

likes.liked: — The staff, the rooms, the view

reviews.title: Stayed here when it was a Radisson but disappointed now it is a Hilton
reviews.text: and hotel staff were really pleasant. I really felt like the hotel was my home away from home. Stayed two nights right before memorial day, and then I went off to the North Shore to a beach house.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were thrilled with the Prince Kuhio Hotel, regardless of the lack of a balcony. We have a 5 year old and stayed on the 31st floor, so no real disappointment to us. Besides, it was posted on their website that the balconies are closed due to renovations. The rooms were great. Clean, bright and the bed was awesome. The glass walls in the bathroom was a nice added touch. Location is good, on the quiter side of Waikiki. The ocen view was beautiful. We appreciated the friendliness of the staff. They were extremely courteous, allowing us to check out late and even provided a courtesy room to freshen up in prior to our late flight back to the States. Nick and Danny were great! We will stay there again on our next trip to Oahu.
reviews.title: Fantastic, would stay again!

likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything to put here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booking back in spring of 2006, we weren't aware of the balcony closure (should've checked this site first!) but we received an upgrade to the 33rd floor w/ ocean view as a consolation. Room had free bottles of water only on first day, a king-size bed which was very comfy, a nice 40" LCD TV, small bar fridge and in-room safe which was very easy to use. Bathroom felt very luxurious with enclosed glass shower and stone tiles. Package included free breakfast (two choices only, but saved us lots of money) in the hotel restaurant MAC24-7. After having a few brekkies there they memorized our orders and last names. Lobby bar offers free hot appies 5-9pm with chips and salsa/guacamole, veggies n' dip and dainties. One night, we didn't need to go out for dinner! Main floor has a nice public bathroom (other hotel's bathrooms were hard to find) and convenient sundries store that sells alcohol, gum, snacks etc. 2nd floor offers free internet access and nice fitness room with brand new equipment. The 2 computers were busy during day, but quiet at night. 10th Floor has large pool but never saw many people take advantage of it. Never had to wait more than a minute for the elevator on any floor we were on and was really speedy. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly and often snuck us extra bottles of water. We were able to get access to a hospitality room to shower and store our luggage due to a late flight, but didn't take advantage of it. Hotel is across the street from an ABC store which sells everything for dirt cheap and is a block away from main drag/beach but still close to all major amenities. Nice location inbetween Diamond Head and Ala Moana Shopping Ctr. I checked out other hotels and they looked dirty, very out-dated and charged for internet. I will DEFINATELY stay at this hotel again!!! Thanks for the great experience!
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

likes.liked: — Everything was beautiful, clean and was in a great location

reviews.title: Don't worry about the old reviews
reviews.text: We just returned from staying at the Hilton Prince Kuhio. Yes, they are still renovating and changing over from a Radisson to a Hilton property. We stayed on the 25th floor with an ocean view. The balconies are still closed due to outside renovations which was a disappointment. The renovations are very nice. We stayed at the same hotel 4 years ago and things are completely changed. The room is very nice and clean. The bathroom is all new with ceramic tile, glass shelving, big shower, plenty of towels. There's a plasma tv in the room, small fridge. The beds are comfortable but only double-sized. The staff was very helpful in giving us a late check-out and storing our luggage because of a late flight. They also gave us a courtesy room for an hour to get ready and change before we left for the airport. The package we had included a breakfast at their restaurant Mac 24/7. The staff are very friendly and helpful there, even learning our names and preferences during our stay. The one drawback was the free breakfast was limited to only a couple of choices but you can order from the menu (a little expensive but large portions). The hotel is located one block from the beach and on a main street (Kuhio) with a bus stop close by. Overall, a good experience. We talked to other travellers at other hotels and they would mention the worn or out-dated surroundings. We felt quite happy being in a newly renovated room. No problems with staying again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over New Years and was very pleased. We had a mountain view room that was newly remodeled. The room was great. Everything brand new. Very clean and comfortable. The balcony was closed off, that was the only bummer. We enjoyed the pool area for laying out and drinks. The lobby bar makes great drinks. Strong and well worth the money. They also have free app. buffet at 5pm. Not many know about it, so a few times we were the only ones grazing on it. It was full of cheese, crackers, veggies, choco covered strawberries, and one hot item (steak one night, wings one night, fish another). We booked and had breakfast included. Breakfast was great. The pancakes are 14 inches!! We probably wouldn't have eaten there every morning if the food wasn't included though, because it is a little pricey. An orange juice is $5. The chef came out a few times during our many breakfasts to make sure things were good. We ordered room service a couple of times and were very pleased. They were prompt and the food was good. The hotel was surprisingly not very busy, which in a way was nice. We never had to wait around for service or fight for a lounge at the pool. Good location to the beach and shopping.
reviews.title: Great Deal

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Waikiki Prince Kuhio for 2 nights on the final stop of our overseas holiday. Please note that the hotel is not directly on Waikiki beach. It is located approximately 3 blocks away or a 5 minute walk. When we pulled up to the hotel, there were no staff members at the door or anywhere in sight to take our bags. Check in staff were tired and disinterested and seemed to want us out of their hair quickly. No smiles or greeting.
reviews.title: Typical Hilton. Nothing special. Staff could be friendlier.

likes.liked: — The room was attractive and very comfortable
likes.disliked: — Staff need to smile more, location a little inconvenient

reviews.text: The room was FANTASTIC. We booked a standard room and were upgraded to an ocean view, which had a small lanai with two chairs. The bathroom was huge, the large flat-panel TV was nice, and the king bed was super comfy. Good sized room for Honolulu, and appears to have been recently refurbished. Nice decor and very modern.
reviews.title: Not great, not terrible either

reviews.text: If you're driving, you must valet your car ($25 a day)...Pretty standard for Honolulu or any 'downtown' hotel. Just be prepared for that. The valet guys were really friendly and helpful. Check-in desk was the same.
reviews.title: Terrible Service- SO SO neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The down side was the 'executive lounge'...As a gold or diamond member, you generally get free access to these at Hiltons. If you are gold/diamond, you know that they can vary from property to property...It was nowhere near one of the better ones. It's located in the basement. Breakfast was strictly continental--bagels, muffins and fruit. The 'evening' spread was pitiful, cheap and the hotel seemed to 'mail it in'--since they have to provide something, they do the minimum, and they make no qualms about it. There were veggies with dip, crackers, and one hot item--one night it was egg rolls, the next night was jalapeno poppers. A mini fridge housed the 'complimentary' soft drinks, with the tackiest sign I've ever seen in an executive lounge. It read, "Limit One Soft Drink Per Person". WOW. So, needless to say, no complimentary cocktails...A sign in the lounge said you could buy a bottle of beer or glass of wine for $5-$8. A far cry from many Hiltons which not only don't limit your Diet Cokes to ONE, but also freely flow booze/wine/beer without charge...Yes, I'm spoiled by other Hiltons around the world. But their limitations seemed pretty tacky and left a bad taste in my mouth, but not enough to spoil what is otherwise a fine hotel. Close to Waikiki beach--about a 7 minute walk to the beach, and great views with the oceanview rooms. Many nearby shops and eateries. We'd probably stay here again if we ever go back to HNL, but probably won't, as it doesn't even compare to Maui--we're already planning next year's trip back to the Islands, and are avoiding Oahu.
reviews.title: Wonderful room and really wonderful bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. Booked at a rate that included breakfast, which we have done at other Hilton properties and which we previously had found to provide good value. Turns out however that would we have picked a cheaper room rate and paid for breakfast, it would have ended up cheaper.
reviews.title: Prince Kuhio is perfect

reviews.text: I just returned from a fantastic trip to waikiki. We stayed at the Hilton Prince Kuhio, and loved it. All though the hotel is not on the beach, it is about two blocks a way not a bad walk at all.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are smaller, but they are all recently remodeled. The beds were very comfortable, and the room is very modern. The restaraunt in the hotel Mac 24\7 had very good food, but there are a number of other places to eat very close to the hotel. I would return to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Therapeudic Relaxation

likes.liked: — Quiet accommodations and serene Mountain views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 35 floor Hilton Prince Kuhio is nestled among other highrises (as are most buildings in Waikiki) and is situated a one long Manhattan block off the beach. What separates this highrise hotel from others is its close proximity (to the beach) and an unobstructed and peaceful view of the mountains. Request mountain view rooms above the 25th floor for a spectacular view! Room 3101 is a personal favorite (and has a larger balcony). All rooms have a balcony (some larger than others) with two lounge chairs - perfect for outdoor relaxation. Room 3101 included a Mini Bar, Flat Screen TV, Insulated Windows, Large Bathroom with Shower (only), an in-room Safe and more.
reviews.title: Loved it, best value and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A restaurant is located on the Lobby floor (Breakfast was tasty and food plentiful). The two story Lobby has beautiful floral appointments and a grand marble entrance. A sitting lounge is situated in the center of the Lobby.
reviews.title: Not a bad place to stay in Waikiki

likes.liked: — Great looking, clean hotel in the heart of Waikiki.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A welcoming and pleasant aroma permeates the Lobby area. Valet parking costs a daily rate of $25 and I suggest calling ahead before retrieving your vehicle.
reviews.title: Not quite up to Hilton standards?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Prince Kuhio from 2/20-2/27/2009 in a king ocean view room. We arrived at the hotel around 5:00 p.m. and had a very smooth checkin. We stayed in room 1818 (18th floor - corner room). We really liked the corner room as it gave us a bigger balcony. All balconies appeared to have two chairs and a small table. We had what we consider an excellent view (please see pictures). From our room, we could see Diamond Head Crater, the ocean and the city. The photo posted of the ocean view is not a zoomed photo. It really is a pretty accurate image of the view we had. The room is exactly what we have come to expect from the Hilton family of hotels. The bathroom was very nicely appointed with the usual Hilton amenities as well as lots of towels. The shower is excellent...lots of hot water and good water pressure. The closet is behind the door which made it a little awkward to get into unless the bathroom door was shut all the way. Plus, it was very small. It would have been difficult to keep our suitcase in there and access the clothing easily. We ended up taking the luggage rack out of the closet and placing it in the room. Minor issue really. We stayed for a week, and the room really lacked drawer space. However, the inroom safe was a very nice convenience as was the refrigerator. The bed, as usual, was a dream. Service at the hotel was excellent. We enjoyed the lobby bar but probably liked the one in Mac 24/7 even better. They had great service and staff. Mac 24/7 was a great restaurant. HUGE cups of coffee, Starbucks, but it tended to be very strong. Just ask for some hot water to add to it if you don't like it that way. What you hear about the pancakes is true. They are about 18" around and about 5-6" high, no kidding. They are HUGE! We never had them but for $15 they are a great deal. They are very, very generous with the portions, so at least you feel like you are getting your money's worth. Internet is free in the business center for everyone. They have about six computers.
reviews.title: Great hotel - exactly what you expect from a Hilton.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside of the Prince Kuhio is it's location and no fault of the hotel. I'm sure if they could do something about it, they would. You are one block off of the beach, and it is very noisy. We were on the 18th floor and it was still loud. In fact, we usually slept with the slider closed to avoid being woken up at 5:00 with the sound of garbage trucks backing up and the buses, which seem to run all the time. We didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel, but it was still bothersome. However, you are in a big city.
reviews.title: Good if you get a Hotwire Deal

reviews.text: Other than that, take THE BUS everywhere.....$2 one way, and if you ride again within two hours, it's free. It will take you about an hour to get to Pearl Harbor by bus, but you can't beat the price. From the airport, we took a taxi, which set us back about $40 because it was around rush hour. However, on our departure, it cost about $32. If you want to get to your hotel quickly, it really is the best way to go. We were there in about 20 minutes. We met a couple that took the shuttle and it took them more than two hours. For us, it was money well spent. Of note, get your bus map at the McDonalds (weird place I know). We didn't find out about it until the day we were leaving. You can get maps of the Waikiki area pretty much everywhere.
reviews.title: I loved it so much, and I am going to have my husband and I stay here also

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our favorite nightly place was the upstairs bar area at Tiki's which is on Kalakaua Avenue (the street that runs along the ocean). The bar menu is much better than the restaurant menu and they have nightly entertainment. They are literally one block away.
reviews.title: Disappointing Hilton

reviews.text: This hotel went through a face lift a couple years ago, the guest room looks fresh and modern. The sleeping quarter and the bathroom look immaculate (I agree the shower door bucks me). But the lack of inroom WIFI or broadband is not good for business travellers. The gym could use some upgrades. I think this hotel is more catered to family. The location of the hotel is great, just a block away from the beach.
reviews.title: Very good, still room to improve.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were happy we decided to stay at this hotel. The rooms were comfortable, well appointed and clean. The hotel staff was friendly and we didn't experience any hiccups during our stay. The hotel is walking distance to the beach and shops. There were at least 2 ABC stores within a block of the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Solid chocie in Waikiki Honolulu

reviews.text: Complimentary breakfast in the lower level for Hilton Honor VIPs consisting of standard continental fare: pastries, breads, cereals, juices, coffee, tea...
reviews.title: Wonderful, clean hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ordered room service for breakfast one of the mornings: HUGE pancakes, when they say huge, they weren’t kidding! I ate maybe a quarter of my pancake (see photos). Hubby enjoyed a Japanese breakfast. As should be expected food here is food is a little expense compared to the mainland.
reviews.title: Exactly what I expected - brilliant!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my family stayed here for 5 days and really loved the hotel. Valet parking (which is a requirement in Waikiki because there is a lack of parking there) is $25/per day, which is more than most hotels, but there's nothing you can do about it, so we just chalked it up to part of the expense of traveling to Hawaii. When we checked in, Frills, a nice lady at the desk, bumped us up to an ocean view room after I mentioned I was originally from Hawaii. (Plus, tourism is down right now and we think the hotel was virtually empty). We were in room 1404--the noise from Kuhio Ave was still heard, but not as bad as staying closer to the ocean and hearing partying and bar-goers all night as we had at different hotels. The hotel is located within walking distance of the beach and we also walked to the aquarium one day, which was a good walk, but our kids did fine. We also appreciated the security--the elevator will not take you to any floors if you don't put your keycard into it.
reviews.title: Loved This Hotel

reviews.text: I really love this hotel. The front desk was so accommodating and nice. Very professional in every way. I got an oceanfront view with a balcony. This hotel is convenient to everything. You can walk everywhere or take the bus. There is a convenient bus route about two blocks from the hotel. I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and all its amenities. The internet in the room was a real plus because I could do my work online. I want to go back to HNL and I will stay in this hotel again. The only thing I will regret is not having my HHonors status when I return. It expires at the end of this year :( .
reviews.title: A excellent hotel close to everything

reviews.text: Enjoyed the view & relaxing on the bacony.
reviews.title: Get the oceanview room...Beautiful!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd have to say the valet was my biggest compliment..I rent a car & couldn't find the hotel & the valet guy made sure to stay on the phone with me until I pulled into Valet. Thank You!!!!! I couldn't have done it without them.
reviews.title: Will definitely be back soon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a very nice hotel. Good location, close to the beach and shopping area. My daughter had fun in the pool. The staff there were friendly and responded to our request quickly. I will definitely go back.
reviews.title: This hotel just works

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here twice and have been very pleased both times. This is a large property in a resort location where it is easy to rest on your laurels. There's no sign of this at the Hilton. The rooms are very functional (often with million dollar views), well maintained, and modern. The staff are very accommodating. Although my primary goal for this trip was tourism, I ended up working more than I would have liked and found that the hotel had the services that I needed.
reviews.title: WOW!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise and are very glad we did.
reviews.title: Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff. Winner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located just a couple blocks from the beach and within walking distance to many restaurants, bars and shops on the main strip in Waikiki. We booked a basic king bed/breakfast room package. The breakfast vouchers given to us at check-in were valid in the MAC 24-7 restaurant and could be used at any time of the day or night. We liked that fact that the restaurant was open 24/7 and had a nice selection of items to choose from. (The pancakes could feed a family of 5! No kidding)
reviews.title: Comfortable Convenient and would certainly go back

reviews.text: Due to my Hilton Gold VIP status, we were upgraded to the 28th floor with a balcony and a beautiful ocean view and executive lounge access where continental breakfast (did not use because of breakfast vouchers we had) and evening appetizers w/no host bar were served. The Hilton Gold VIP status also gave us free internet in the room. We were told that wireless internet is free to all guests in the LOBBY ONLY.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a decent size, nothing over the top, but was clean and comfortable with a very large flat screen TV, desk, chair and sofa. The bathroom was a good size with a large shower and plenty of vanity space. The only thing I did not care for was that the only available closet was located in the bathroom. No big deal though, it worked just fine. The entire hotel appeared to have been recently remodeled and looked great.
reviews.title: celebrating over 30 years of marrige

reviews.text: The staff at check in and in the restaurants could not have been nicer and the location of this hotel is really good. Close to Diamond Head, Queen's Surf Beach, Zoo and many other shops, restaurants and attractions. It's great for singles, couples or the entire family. It had a large pool with sunning area and the grounds are very well maintained and look beautiful. We used the fitness room which was not hugh but very adequate. They also have a business center with computers and printers. We totally recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd stay there again if we went back to Oahu.
reviews.title: Still being renovated

reviews.text: Clean and tidy. Still in renovation mode. Staff were helpful without being exceptional. Had no problems with anything being stolen. Hotel restaurant MAC24/7 serves a single menu 24/7 (hence name). Had two meals there - dinner both times. Was going to have breakfast there but got sick of waiting to be served. Hotel is in the process of changing mangement from Radisson chain to Hilton and are very short staffed. Food was ok without being brilliant. Grab a "This Week Oahu" brochure on arrival and use the 25% off voucher at the Pacific Hotel across the road for their all you can eat breakfast buffet. Better value, better ambience. Have to be there between 6 and 8.00am though. Will be returning to Hawaii in 2008 but will not be staying here.
reviews.title: staff are thieves!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here the last week in June on business. The place used to be a Radisson but I believe now that it is a Hitlon it is undergoing renovations. The rooms have a modern/contemporary decor and the beds were very comfortable. The best feature were the 42 in LCD hign def TVs in the rooms with a wide selection of movies. One night the cable TV went out so I was able to watch a movie (ppv) on the house.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but wait for all renovations to be complete.

reviews.text: The one odd thing is that wall seemed exceptionally thin in that I could hear a lot of noise from the neighboring rooms and hallways. Another thing is the bathroom has no bath, only an oversized shower.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel last year for 5 nights, the staff were very helpful and pleasant .
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were big and spacious. The food was wonderful especially the pancakes..........
reviews.title: Enjoyable Visit - Spectacular Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1 pancake would feed 3 people.............
reviews.title: Great stopover
Outstanding customer service
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With just one short stay in Waikiki before our trip to Asia, we thankfully chose this hotel and were very satisfied. We were upgraded to a corner room with a balcony overlooking Waikiki towards the ocean, just stunning. The management team is so accommodating. I would highly recommend this hotel and will keep it in mind for my next trip to Waikiki. I will plan to stay longer and enjoy the comforts of the room and hotel. Thanks for a short but great stay!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: The Radisson was a great place to stay. The lobby quiet and beautiful, the service was great. Uppon check in when they found out that it was our annaversary they upgraded our room to a ocean view room on the 32 floor. The view was great. The room was clean, smoke free, had every thing we needed. Though we were not on the beach, it was not far away to get to. Our stay here was very peaceful, little hustle and bustle which helped have a relaxed stay. The location is close to a lot of enjoyable dinning.
reviews.title: A great Stay
Great Stay
reviews.text: Every thing you want to do in Waikiki is a short walking distance away, stay here and relax, then go out and have fun.

reviews.title: Could do better...
reviews.text: My fiancee and I stayed at the Radisson Waikiki in late December 2005 for our wedding/honeymoon and had a wonderful experience. I researched hotels in and around the beach for hours and finally decided on the Radisson because of the value for our dollars and the nice location (only a block away from the beach, which was close enough to walk, but far enough from all the hub-bub to feel secluded). We reserved an Ocean-View room, and got a reasonable deal on it. I made sure to call ahead to let the staff know it would be a special occasion for us. When we arrived, they arranged for us to have a room on the 37th floor, which had a spectacular view of the beach. They also gave us free breakfast buffet passes for our entire stay, and gave us a pass for a free bottle of champagne. These were very nice small touches that meant a lot to us. We found the staff, from the valets, to the receptionists, to the restaurant staff, to all be helpful and pleasant. The breakfast buffet at Trelliss's was also really good and had all the staples (eggs, pancakes, hashbrowns, sausage, french toast, etc), which I didn't grow tired of during our stay. The room itself was basic, but clean, with nice furniture, and a great balcony. We found we had enough space to spread out. I also never heard anyone else in the rooms around us, which was nice. I didn't find the bathroom to be too small, which seemed to be a common complaint among the various hotel reviews. Not much else to add, except that we would definitely stay at Radisson again.
By the way, note that the hotel advertised that it would be undergoing room renovations through Fall 2006.
reviews.title: Nice overall experience

reviews.text: Take it or leave it...one couple's thoughts. P.S. We'd recommend Hula Grill as a good place to eat, and be sure to ask for directions to the local bakery that sells malasatas (puff pastrys dipped in sugar).
reviews.title: great hotel great location

reviews.text: thanks for ruining the trip radission.management no help.
reviews.title: 3rd time is a charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: brian
reviews.title: Beware Ventilation / Air Quality Issues

reviews.text: atlanta
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.disliked: — Bathroom and balconies were a tad small

reviews.text: The staff at the valet and bell service was very helpful. My family of four arrived at 1 am and just came off a long flight from WA. We had a lot of bags which did not fit the rental car. My 4 year old son was already sleeping in the car and we had to go back to the airport to pick up the rest of our bags. MR. Ryan N. greeted us and saw that we were tired. After explaining our situation Ryan Nakashima said "don't worry about it you just sit back and we will take care of it". He pulled our bags from the car, tagged it and handed bottled water to my wife. On our return with the rest of our bags, he picked up all the bags and gave my wife a ticket. Just check in and we will deliver your bags to your room. We had 12 bags and most were heavy. When we got to our room, a few minutes later Ryan delivered our bags to our room. I wanted to help but Ryan said "just sit and relax you had a long day". That for us was extremely helpful in making us comfortable. This gave us the feeling we were in a safe place and can relax now. MR. Ryan N. made our stay extremely satisfying. His one of those who will go out of his way to make you comfortable. The Hilton is very fortunate to have him part of their staff. Thanks Ryan!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Valet and Bell service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because the reviews were great and we were happy to pay a premium price for an ocean deluxe room. We booked through a travel agent who did not know she had to request a king room and we were given two double beds which were really only king single size. It is supposed to be 4 star deluxe. But the room was very small, narrow, the balcony tiny with a limited view of the ocean through two high rise buildings in front and that was the 21st floor! When we asked for a king suite we were told we could have one 3 floors below us but not higher. The wardrobe is in the bathroom, my suitcase had to go under the 'desk' ( and it is not a large suitcase) and the desk chair had to fit down by the window. Staff were not overly helpful but friendly. The pool area was buffeted with wind every day, sterile but reasonable to sunbathe and swim. It is close to town and beach and all amenities. The hotel was obviously booked up and very busy but they had deals on line which would have been much, much better value than what we paid. I would definitely not stay there again, nor recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many Hilton's in Honolulu and when I read the reviews this was the best voted among All, but I was in for disappointments I booked a deluxe ocean view but when we arrived the hotel
reviews.title: Average Hotel
Great hotel, enjoyable stay
reviews.text: Was not right,At the Waikiki Beach i mean not on front line and we were given seventh or eighth floor and the ocean view
Was very far away and we requested a King bed but given a twin bed and we pleaded that it was
reviews.title: Great trip

reviews.text: I booked the hotel by naming my price of $100/night. I thought that we would be given the worst room in the hotel. But we got a ninth floor ocean view room. It was a wonderful view! We saw nice sail boats in the ocean and people surfing too. Also, we could get city view and saw dimond head from the balcony. The staffs are very friendly. One thing I don't like is that the bathroom is tiny and the toilet is very old. Another funny thing is that the coffee in the room is 10% Kona coffee, which make me keep thinking what is the other 90%!
reviews.title: Better than I expected
Adequate
reviews.text: We stayed here from 7/10-7/15 and found the hotel to be convenient, fairly clean,needing updating but decent value for the money. We didn't get a priceline type price-paid 199 per nt. and that included a breakfast buffet. The mountainview was nice on the 23rd floor. The pool area was too windy..but again overall it was ok. Area was quiet and if you are there to tour the island it is ADEQUATE.

My husband, teen son, and I stayed for a week at this hotel. We had no problems with the elevators and found that it was convenient to shopping and a short walk to the beach. However, when other reviewers said that the bathrooms were small, I never imagined how small they would be...VERY SMALL. Also, the tub didn't look as clean as I would have hoped and if we left a drink on the nightstand small little bugs (tiny, strange ants perhaps?) would arrive promptly. Sometimes the sheets had small holes in them. We were on the 8th floor and I warn others that it is very noisy from the traffic outside during the night, even with the door to the balcony closed tightly. Laying in bed it sounded like I was on the sidewalk of a busy city. The view from the balcony was beautiful though and the employees were helpful and friendly. Unfortunately, the price of parking went up to $20/day, which I had not known in advance. Next time, I'd stay in a hotel right across the street from Waikiki beach where there is still access to shopping and I could watch my son surf from the balcony.
reviews.title: Some positives, some negatives
Used to love the Radisson...
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson four times over the past several years, and kept going back because our first two visits were wonderful. This was before they started renovations and apparently changed owners.

The lobby used to be a comfortable-yet-dated place to hang out with a huge seating area and a tiny little bar staffed by very friendly bartenders. They have since renovated the lobby and changed it into a slightly less comfortable seating area with a kind of snooty bar, and moved all the friendly bar staff up to the pool bar.
reviews.title: Prince Kuhio would be proud of his namesake!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is undergoing renovations to become a Hilton and should not have been open. In fact I think it may be closed now because I no longer see it listed on radisson.com, but I'm writing this review anyways to express my dissatisfaction with Radisson.
reviews.title: Horrible Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was aware that the hotel was undergoing renovations when I made my reservation; however, it was not made clear that the renovations would cause such a disruption to my vacation.
reviews.title: Great Location! Great value!

description: Hilton Waikiki Beach Hotel, located in the heart of Waikiki, is just steps from Waikiki Beach. This property is a blend of modern, understated elegance combined with true Hawaiian character. Hotel is 100% smoke-free and offers valet-only parking as part of its top tier service. An exciting new addition is MAC 24-7 featuring modern American cooking influenced by fresh local ingredients, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
